Subject: Hiring Algorithm

We’re working on a hiring algorithm that uses machine learning. Basically, we will teach a computer program to hire just as you would, but at a faster pace!

How does that work?

That's great.

The algorithm will analyze a lot of past job applications, both successful and unsuccessful, and use that to figure out how a good job applicant looks like - in numbers!

How will you make a machine think?

Works for me

It’s impossible for the program to recognize good and bad candidates without any human input - we first need to give it a *lot of data* to learn from.

Where do we get the data?

Let's feed it data then!

I need your help with this part: could you send me the CVs of all the candidates (‘cv_all.zip’) you’ve evaluated so far? It should be somewhere on your desktop

Click cv_all.zip to send data

Thanks! Choose a company below that best aligns with our hiring vision, and that will do the trick!
